The Cocoa Beach Country Club is a public facility welcoming both residents and guests. Offering three nine-hole courses – Dolphin, Lakes, and River Courses ‘ plan to hone your skills with the challenging greens and up to 50 sand bunkers per course. The Country Club also has an onsite restaurant, ‘The 19th Hole Restaurant,’ featuring a full bar, snacks, breakfast and lunch. Banquet Facilities are offered at reasonable prices for special gatherings and celebrations. Appropriate dress attire is required which means no tank tops or cutoff shirts. Discounts are available so check online or call ahead of your visit. Government Services Residents Business Visitors Search Home Government Departments Leisure Services Weddings and Receptions Weddings, Receptions and Events Cocoa Beach Leisure Services provide several locations that are available for rental for your special event. We strive to provide excellent customer service, by overseeing the outdoor special event permitting process and are here to help you through your planning process. Beach Wedding Ceremony Country Club Facilities City Facilities Beach Wedding Ceremony Thank you for choosing Cocoa Beach for your Beach Wedding Ceremony. Our City staff is here to answer questions and concerns. Your Wedding on the Beach Wedding Ceremony Location Cocoa Beach offers 6 miles of Atlantic Ocean Beaches. Looking for the right location for you? Let us suggest one of 3 oceanfront parks with restrooms and easy parking access: Alan Shepard Park Lori Wilson Park Sidney Fischer Park How to Apply for a Permit 50 Attendees or Less To start the process on a small intimate wedding of 50 people or less in attendance you fill out the Beach Wedding Ceremony Permit Form online. 51 and more Attendees If your wedding will be larger than 50 guests,  we do ask that you fill out the Special Events Application . This is a more detailed form but, provides the staff and public safety departments with the information required to ensure that the event runs smoothly. Permit Fee The Beach Ceremony Permit fee is $50. Application must be completed 30 days before the event. If you are mailing a check please send check to: City of Cocoa Beach 321 Ramp Road Cocoa Beach, FL 32931 For more information on Beach Wedding Ceremonies please contact the City Event Coordination Staff at 321-868-3252 or via email . Country Club Facilities Facilities The Cocoa Beach Country Club is a great option for your wedding or next event. We have hosted many weddings, civic events, and receptions. Our staff is excited to help make your special day one to remember! Government Services Residents Business Visitors Search Home Government City Commission City Commission The City of Cocoa Beach has a City Commission - City Manager form of government, adopted by the citizens on June 19, 1958. The City Commission is the legislative branch of City Government and is responsible for enacting policy. The City Manager administers policy as the executive officer of the City. Five Commission members, one of which is the Mayor, are elected at large by the voters of Cocoa Beach to serve for a four-year term. The Mayor presides at all meetings and performs duties delegated to the Mayor by the City Charter and City Commission. The Vice-Mayor is elected yearly by the City Commission at the annual organizational meeting, held after an election. Meetings The first and third Thursday of each month, at 7:00 p.m. Held at Cocoa Beach Country Club, 5000 Tom Warriner Blvd, Cocoa Beach, FL 32931 Are open to the public. Agendas and Minutes Available on our meeting platform, Agenda and Minutes . Meet the Cocoa Beach City Commission Mayor Keith Capizzi, Seat 1 (Term expires November 2028) Email  Mayor Keith Capizzi Elected as Commissioner in 2022 for a two-year term, Keith Capizzi has been a resident of Cocoa Beach for over 30 years.  Per the City Charter Section 2,06, on August 23, 2023, Vice-Mayor Capizzi became Mayor due to the resignation of Mayor Ben Malik.  Mayor Capizzi has 21 years of machinist, metallurgy, and marine experience, while serving as a Merchant Marine, and working as an Engineer.  He owns a property management company, manages a Reggae Radio station, and a few Facebook pages. He considers himself a problem solver, and fiscally responsible.  He loves Cocoa Beach for the small town feel where anyone can go anywhere, and see someone they know.  Mayor Capizzi is a proud husband and father of one.  He attends Club Zion Church where his father is the pastor. Commissioner Joshua Jackson, Seat 2 (Term expires November 2028) Email Commissioner Joshua Jackson Appointed on September 6, 2023, to fill the remaining term of Seat 2, Joshua Jackson has been a resident of Cocoa Beach since 2018. Commissioner Jackson holds a Chemical Engineering degree from USC and a Master's in Engineering Management from GWU.  He has applied his education in program management for the Navy's Strategic Systems programs (SSP) Trident II D5 Missile System. He has also applied his education in IT Systems engineering, IT Operations Management and innovation mainstream for the National Geospatial-Intelligence Agency and Marine Corps. Cocoa Beach is his favorite place on earth. He understands that change is inevitable and knows the importance of making sure that they are the right kind of changes to keep Cocoa Beach healthy and vibrant.  Commissioner Jackson is a husband and father of two  sons.  His family and him attends Club Zion in Cocoa Beach. Commissioner Tim Tumulty, Seat 3 (Term expires November 2028) Email Commissioner Tim Tumulty Elected as Commissioner in 2024, Commissioner Skip Williams, Seat 4 (Term expires November 2026) Email Commissioner Skip Williams Elected as Commissioner in 2007, Skip Williams is originally from Indian River County, Florida and has been a resident of Cocoa Beach since 1986. He holds a Mechanical Engineering Degree from the Florida Institute of Technology and a Master’s Degree in Engineering Project Management from the University of Central Florida. Currently employed at NASA, he works in the Exploration Ground Systems Program. Commissioner Williams takes an active role in community programs, having served as the Chairperson of the Cocoa Beach Waterways and Wildlife Board, graduated from the Cocoa Beach Citizen’s Academy, and is a member of the Fire Department Community Emergency Response Team (CERT). His affiliations include: volunteering for Keep Brevard Beautiful and House of Hope; attends Calvary Chapel Merritt Island. Commissioner Jeremy Hutcherson, Seat 5 (Term expires November 2026) Email Commissioner Jeremy Hutcherson Elected as Commissioner in 2022, Jeremy Hutcherson is originally from Atlanta, Georgia, and began calling Cocoa Beach home in 2011.  He holds a Bachelor in Mechanical Engineering from Georgia Tech and a MBA from the University of Florida.  Jeremy has over 25 years of engineering and project management experience in military weapon system development, and is now a Project Engineer for a local aerospace defense contractor. He is affiliated with Project Management Institute, Indian River Flying Club and Aircraft Owners & Pilots Association. Jeremy is passionate about keeping Cocoa Beach a safe, family-friendly community and maintaining a healthy appreciation for our natural resources.  The Hutcherson family enjoy an active, outdoor lifestyle and are involved at The Pointe Church in Cocoa Beach. Government Services Residents Business Visitors Search Home Government Departments Leisure Services Cocoa Beach Country Club A Public Facility Cocoa Beach Country Club A Public Facility THIS WEEK'S GOLF COURSE UPDATE: NEW HEAD PRO / SHOP MGR Brent Naylor Brent started with us back in late April and we wanted to formally welcome him aboard.  Brent brings a ton of experience to us and will be a valuable asset as we continue to improve our facilities, programs and shop.  Brent's impact has already been felt with tournaments, course ideas and in the pro shop. The next time you are in, please introduce yourself to Brent and welcome him aboard! HOURS OF OPERATION Pro Shop 7:00 AM to 6:30 PM Hours are subject to change due to weather. Driving Range Opens: Friday - Wednesday 7:00am; Thursday 9:00am Closes: Thursday - Tuesday (varies due to sunset, times posted in Pro Shop weekly); Wednesday 6:00pm (due to the range needing to be clean picked) ball dispenser closes 30 minutes prior to the range closing Restrooms Course closes at dusk Clubhouse closes when the bar closes. 19th Hole Restaurant Hours Bar: 7:30 AM to 7:00 PM Kitchen: 11:00 am - 6:00 pm Monday - Thursday 11:00 am - 6:30 pm Friday 9:00 am - 6:30 pm Saturday 9:00 am - 6:00 pm Sunday The Cocoa Beach Country Club is a public facility, we welcome residents and guests to the area alike. The Course boasts three courses - Dolphin, Lakes, and River Courses - featuring 27 holes and 41-50 sand bunkers per course. If you're ready, you can book a Tee Time Online , or call the Starter Shack at 321-868-3361.  You cannot book same day tee times online, you must call the Starter for same day times. Reservations can be cancelled only by contacting the Pro Shop at 321-868-3351 Course Policies Mandatory carts on the Main Course before noon between December 15th and April 15th. Walking is allowed on the second and third courses during this timeframe. Dress code includes: Appropriate golf attire required.  Shirts must be worn at all times.  Beachwear, such as tank tops, muscle shirts, swimsuits (men and women), sport bras or cutoff shorts are not permitted. Discounts Available: Twilight Rates and Junior Discounts. Weather Policy Due to unforeseen weather issues, the golf course could be closed. Please call our main phone number ( 321-868-3351) and press #1 for up-to-the-minute course and driving range conditions.  Closing of the golf course may affect the operation of the 19th Hole restaurant. Shortened hours, according to activity, such as 9 AM to 2 PM or closing of the restaurant may occur after the course is closed. Best Location In The County The Cocoa Beach Country Club is located on a peninsula surrounded by the Banana River Lagoon at the western end on Minutemen Causeway in Cocoa Beach. The Course welcomes locals and visitors alike. Since the greens renovation project in 2009, we now have some of the best Paspalum greens in the county. There are three nine hole courses that provide an excellent variety for the recreational golfer. Attractive Habitats The Banana River and the seventeen lakes that are located on the golf course at the Cocoa Beach Country Club provide a habitat that attracts an abundance of waterfowl and other birds. The birds provide an enjoyable attraction for the golfers. Assigning a name to each golf hole is one of the oldest traditions in the game of golf. The Cocoa Beach Country Club has named each of its 27 golf holes after one of the predominant species of birds seen on the golf course. The granite tee signs portray the name of the bird for each golf hole. Wildlife The waterfowl, other birds, the dolphins, alligators, turtles and raccoons make the Cocoa Beach Country Club a true habitat and wildlife sanctuary for the enjoyment of all golfers. Course features include putting greens, a driving range and a "19th hole" where you can get a bite to eat, a beverage of your choice and reminisce over the great golf shots you just made! The CBCC also features banquet facilities at reasonable prices to host those special gatherings and celebrations. The 19th Hole Restaurant Begin or end your day on the course, or off, at the19th Hole Restaurant located in the Country Club, featuring a full bar, snacks, breakfast and lunch. For more information visit the 19th Hole Information Page .
